data.title: Embracing Stoicism: The Life and Lessons of Marcus Aurelius

data.text:
Marcus Aurelius is one of the most profound stoics in history. He had what many consider to be a disaster ridden life, something that would make lesser men lose hope, become weak and fragile. Somehow Marcus was able to bear these burdens very worthily. He structured his life around concerning himself with only what he could control, and letting life happen unto him just as it happens to everyone else. He accepted exactly what life gave to him whether that was a blessing or a horrific event. I was enthralled by his story and mindset, as he was also the first stoic I followed. So, today I am going to share a small piece of his story with you all.

Marcus was born into a prominent family, but that didn’t necessarily mean it was easy for him. His father died when he was a mere toddler, shortly after his mother left him, he was raised by his grandfather. This is where he started to be taught at home. This is also where he was first introduced to stoicism. He was a gifted scholar and remained so into old age.

“From my grandfather’s father, I learned to dispense with attendance at public schools, and to enjoy good teachers at home, and to recognize that on such things money should be eagerly spent.” — Marcus Aurelius
